text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

IRM 4.13.5 - Replaces IRM 4.13.5, Automated Substitute for Return (ASFR) , with content from IRM 4.13.8, Exam SFR Reconsiderations, which was duplicated content. ASFR reconsiderations are contained in IRM 5.18.1. This IRM has been combined and restructured to enhance clarity for Exam SFR. All IPU’s from IRM 4.13.8 are incorporated and listed below in (7) - (20).
4.13.5.2 (5) replaced Letter 143C with Form 3531 and Letter 2416C.
14U0509 issued 03-20-2014 IRM 4.13.8.4 - Changed content with deletions of obsolete content added content on return verification.
IPU 14U0509 issued 03-20-2014 IRM 4.13.8.4.1 - Clarified and added new content.

IPU 14U0509 issued 03-20-2014 IRM 4.13.8.4.5 - Renumbered from 4.13.8.6. Removed references to IRM 5.18. Added content specific to priority codes used with Exam TC 300 SFR assessments. Added content on previously abated penalties.
IPU 14U0509 issued 03-20-2014 Exhibit 4.13.8–1 - New exhibit on common freeze codes.

(1) A reconsideration occurs when the Service processes a Substitute for (SFR) and the taxpayer subsequently files an original return. (2) These procedures will ensure : a. The amount of tax assessed is correct. b. Cases are handled in a consistent manner. (3) The audience for this IRM Section includes: a. SB/SE Exam Reconsideration examiners. b. W & I Exam Reconsideration examiners. (1) All W & I Exam SFR Reconsideration cases will be worked in the receiving campus. of (2) Refer complex issues to Classification. Review IRM 4.19.11.1.3 , for Screening Individual Returns, to identify issues that are not conducive to W & I correspondence audit. Follow the “Accepted” instructions below for all other cases. (3) If Classification determines that the case should be: IF and THEN Accepted, Assign to Centralized Reconsideration Unit (CRU). Do not establish on AIMS. Make the appropriate changes to the account per the return filed. Selected for Campus, the only issue is Do not establish on income, AIMS. Work the case following audit recon procedures. Note: When transferring a case to the AO, refer to IRM 4.13.3.5 procedures. (4) The CEAS Audit Recon record will be updated accordingly. a. If the case is “Accepted” by Classification, the CEAS record should be updated with Status 7600 - Full Allowance. Also update the abatement field in the CEAS record. It is not necessary to send a revised report or acknowledgment letter on SFR returns that are accepted in full. The taxpayer will receive a computer generated notice notifying them of the tax adjustment based on the acceptance of their delinquent filed return. b. If the case is “Selected” by Classification and the only issue, income, is allowed after Audit Reconsideration, update the CEAS record with Status 7600 – Full Allowance. Also update the Abatement field in the CEAS record. c. If the case is “Selected” by Classification and the only issue, income, is disallowed after Audit Reconsideration, update the CEAS record with Status 7400 – Full Disallowance. ) If an unsigned return is submitted in response to an SFR notice, whether it is claim for a refund or reports additional tax due, do not accept or process. The return is invalid. Reject to the taxpayer with Form
Review the return for other missing items and request all missing required information. Form
will include instructions to the taxpayer that they may fax the return or mail back to the reconsideration unit. Insure the correct fax number and address with Stop numbered is included.
Exception: Do not mail back numbered returns or returns with date stamps. Corre- spond with the taxpayer for signature with jurat statement using Letter 2416C.

Suspend the case for 45 days with Status Code 7700. If the taxpayer does not respond to Letter 2416C, treat the case as a full disallowance. For closing actions, see IRM 4.13.3.8.3, Closing Procedures-Full Allowance. Document the with your decision.
Note: After 45 days in status 7700, case will close through “Autoclose” feature. See IRM 4.13.3.8, Closing Procedures.

The unit CFf coordinator screens all mailbox receipts. When a Revenue Officer (RO) secures a delinquent return, they will prepare Form

and forward the return to the appropriate campus. The RO is responsible for making sure the return is signed correctly, all income is reported and contains correct SSN’s. Examiners must math verify all income, SSNs and appropriate schedules attached. If the return is incomplete, contact the RO and have the missing information faxed. If this can’t be done, reject the form back to the RO.
Tax examiners will contact RO if return is incomplete (

) Abusive Tax Avoidance Transactions (ATAT) (cid:

) An Abusive Tax Avoidance Transaction (ATAT) is any plan, or transaction designed, sold, or promoted by an individual, promoter, or return for the purpose of circumventing tax laws or evading tax obligations, and offered to a person or entity with U. S. tax obligations to obtain tax not allowed by law. (cid:
) Per IRM
, Substitute for Return Reconsiderations, SFR assess- ments with an Exam ATAT project code will have identifier “OPEN ATAT” TXMOD History. (cid:
) Per IRM

), Substitute for Return Reconsiderations, when a quent return with a History Item ″OPENATAT″ is received, the examiner contact the ATAT Coordinator where the taxpayer is located to verify that the ″OPENATAT″ identifier is correct. A listing of ATAT coordinators is located at the Abusive Transactions website at: Abusive Tax Avoidance Transaction – Collection Coordinator Area Contacts (cid:

page 8 4.13 Audit Reconsideration IF AND THEN The ATAT identifier is correct, 1. 1. Contact the ATAT Coordi- nator to obtain the name, phone number, and fax number of the revenue officer assigned to the account. 2. Provide a copy of the return to the revenue officer by facsimile. 3. Suspend the case for 15 days until pertinent informa- tion is received from the revenue officer. 4. If pertinent information is not received within 15 business days, forward the return to Ogden:Internal Revenue Service Classification Team 101 Mailstop 4705 1973 N Rulon White Blvd Ogden, UT 84404 5. Prepare Special Handling Alert sheet and attach to the front of the case. Include a notation at the bottom of the ATAT Special Handling Alert ″Pertinent information available but not received.″ The name and telephone number for the assigned revenue officer will be included.
All ″OPENATAT″ cases will be classified in Ogden.
Computing the Failure to File Penalty (FTF) a. The FTF penalty is assessed on balance due returns filed after the due date or the extended due date. See IRM
, Failure To File/Failure To Pay, for complete information. b. Exam SFR assessments usually post the FTF penalty manually with a TC
c. If the TC
has Priority code
or
, input TC
for correct calc- ualtion d. If the TC
does not have Priority code
or
, manually compute the FTF penalty
page (
) Computing the Failure to Pay Penalty a. The FTP penalty is assessed on tax not paid by the due date of the return, without regards to any extension to file. See IRM
, Failure File/Failure To Pay, for complete information on calculating the FTP penalty. b. If the TC
has Priority code
or
, the FTP will systemically on tax decreases. If tax is being increased, the FTP must be manually computed. c. If the TC
has no Priority code
or
, manually compute the FTP.
should not be used if the Exam SFR assessment did not contain priority code
or
Instead, the penalty has to be manually computed adjusted. (

) Computing the Estimated Tax (ES) Penalty a. Taxpayers are required to have tax withheld as income is received or make estimated tax payments during the year. When a taxpayer fails to take one of these actions, he/she may be subject to the ES penalty. See IRM
, Estimated Tax Penalties, for complete information on computing the ES penalty. b. The ES penalty will always be manually computed. c. Priority code
needs to be input when adjusting all withholding tax with TC
) Previously Abated Penalties a. Cases that have penalty reversals that include A TC
with RC
and PRC
or
should not have the ES, FTF, or FTP penalties assessed on any balance due. (
) All returns must be reviewed to ensure protection of all statutes of limitation. See IRM
, Statute of Limitations, for specific instructions on statute tion. See IRM
, When a Document Is Treated As Filed Under the IRC, to determine the return received date, and to determine the date the return is considered filed under the IRC. Note: Per IRM

, Statute Returns,- No review for statute clearance is necessary for original returns secured by Compliance employees. Do not route to the Statute Control Unit any original return secured or any returns prepared under the authority of IRC
(b). Forward returns to files after input of adjustment. (

) Refund Statute Expiration Date (RSED) a. The RSED is generally three years from the Return Due Date (RDD) for payments and prepaid credits if a return was filed, or two years from the payment date for other payments whichever is later. See IRM
, Statute of Limitations Processes and Procedures, for further b. SFR Reconsiderations are original returns. Generally, prepaid credits be claimed within

years of the due date of the return with regard to extension. Therefore, if a SFR Reconsideration is received more than three years from the due date with regard to extensions, a refund of prepaid credits should not be made. There are conditions that extend RSED, see IRM
, Statute of Limitations Processes and Internal Revenue Manual
a. The FTP penalty is assessed on tax not paid by the due date of the return, without regards to any extension to file. See IRM
, Failure File/Failure To Pay, for complete information on calculating the FTP penalty. b. If the TC

, the FTP will systemically on tax decreases. If tax is being increased, the FTP must be manually computed. c. If the TC

should not be used if the Exam SFR assessment did not contain priority code

4.13.5.4.6 (12-16-2015) Statute of Limitation

Refund Statute Expiration Date (RSED) a. The RSED is generally three years from the Return Due Date (RDD) for payments and prepaid credits if a return was filed, or two years from the payment date for other payments whichever is later. See IRM
, Statute of Limitations Processes and Procedures, for further explanations. b. SFR Reconsiderations are original returns. Generally, prepaid credits must be claimed within

years of the due date of the return with regard to extension. Therefore, if a SFR Reconsideration is received more than three years from the due date with regard to extensions, a refund of prepaid credits should not be made. There are conditions that extend the RSED, see IRM
, Statute of Limitations Processes and Procedures.

Audit c. Generally, the amount to be credited or refunded is limited to the tax during the three years immediately preceding the filing of a claim, plus period of any extension of time to file. Therefore, even if prepaid credits are barred, available credits paid within three years of the received date the SFR Reconsiderations are not barred. d. Do not allow any overpayment of prepaid credits or subsequent to refund or offset if the RSED has expired. Note: Do not solely rely on the RSED posted to TXMODA to determine if credits should be offset or refunded. Follow disallowance procedures in IRM Statute of Limitations Processes and Procedures. e. When barring a refund, take the following actions: (cid:
) Use Hold Code
on the ADJ
on IDRS- Hold Code
will hold the on the module and suppress the Notice of Adjustment. (cid:
) Send
C letter with Appeal Rights- The
C explains that the refund cannot be released. (cid:
) Prepare Form
, Excess Collection File Addition with as much tion as possible at the time the adjustment is input. Form
is used to transfer the barred credit from the module to the Excess Collection File (XSF). (cid:
) A copy of the prepared Form
must be included in the closed case released for PAS review. (cid:
) The form
must be submitted for processing within five (
) business days of the adjustment posting. Note: In the instance of a balance due return, where subsequent payments are barred, it will not be possible to complete box #
until the adjustment has posted. (cid:
